intro: Leonohebe odora, commonly known as the fragrant leonohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and small, showy flowers. The plant produces violet-blue or purple flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to rocky soils. Leonohebe odora is often found in coastal and alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
